sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The Rand.Real function returns a pseudo-random number in the range zero to one. For example, if x is a real number, after x := Rand.Real, x would have a value such as 0.729548 or 0.352879.
sections.text_content: The Rand.Real function returns a pseudo-random number in the range zero to one. For example, if x is a real number, after x := Rand.Real, x would have a value such as 0.729548 or 0.352879.
sections.mdown_content: The **Rand.Real** function returns a pseudo-random number in the range zero to one. For example, if _x_ is a real number, after _x_ := **Rand.Real**, _x_ would have a value such as 0.729548 or 0.352879.

sections.title: Example
code:
loop
            if Rand.Real > 0.5 then
                put "Hi ho, hi ho"
            else
                put "It's off to work we go"
            end if
        end loop
sections.raw_content: This program repeatedly and randomly prints out Hi ho, hi ho or It's off to work we go.
sections.text_content: This program repeatedly and randomly prints out Hi ho, hi ho or It's off to work we go.
sections.mdown_content: This program repeatedly and randomly prints out _Hi ho_, _hi ho_ or _It's off to work we go_.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
The Rand.Real function sets its parameter to the next value of a sequence of pseudo-random real numbers that approximates a uniform distribution over the range 0<r <1.

Each time a program runs, Rand.Real uses a different pseudo-random number sequence. To always get the same sequence (actually, to start the sequence at the same point), use the Rand.Set procedure.

To use several sequences of repeatable pseudo-random number sequences, use the Rand.Seed and Rand.Next procedures.
sections.text_content:
The Rand.Real function sets its parameter to the next value of a sequence of pseudo-random real numbers that approximates a uniform distribution over the range 0<r <1.
Each time a program runs, Rand.Real uses a different pseudo-random number sequence. To always get the same sequence (actually, to start the sequence at the same point), use the Rand.Set procedure.
To use several sequences of repeatable pseudo-random number sequences, use the Rand.Seed and Rand.Next procedures.
sections.mdown_content:
The **Rand.Real** function sets its parameter to the next value of a sequence of pseudo-random real numbers that approximates a uniform distribution over the range 0<_r_ <1.

Each time a program runs, **Rand.Real** uses a different pseudo-random number sequence. To always get the same sequence (actually, to start the sequence at the same point), use the **Rand.Set** procedure.

To use several sequences of repeatable pseudo-random number sequences, use the **Rand.Seed** and **Rand.Next** procedures.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Rand.Real, not by calling Real.
sections.text_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling Rand.Real, not by calling Real.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling **Rand.Real**, not by calling **Real**.
